derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Anglo-Norman French puliol (based on Latin pulegium 'thyme') + real 'royal'

means.word_mean: 1. Eurasian perennial mint have small lilac-blue flowers and ovate leaves; yields an aromatic oil
2. erect hairy branching American herb having purple-blue flowers; yields an essential oil used as an insect repellent and sometimes in folk medicine
